headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Nazmul Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu c Rubel Hossain b Nazmul Hossain 83 (103b 8x4 0x6 136m) SR: 80.58

dismissalComment.html: and out of nowhere, they pull off a stunner, Taibu is gone, big wicket, it was a high full toss whipped away wide of long leg where Rubel made good ground, dived forward to take it low, and then went scrambling along the ground

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Rubel Hossain 74 (100b 4x4 2x6 145m) SR: 74

dismissalComment.html: got 'em, Rubel uproots the leg stump, full delivery slanted in, Masakadza makes room to go over the off side, misses the swing, and the Rubel hits, finally the stand has been broken

they have got the big one, they haven't given anything away today, Sibanda goes for the pull, is in no position as the short ball gets big on him outside off, and the edge comes down on the off side, Kayes reaches to it and finds Shakib settling under the ball, but manages to hold on and then stares at Shakib
got 'em, Rubel uproots the leg stump, full delivery slanted in, Masakadza makes room to go over the off side, misses the swing, and the Rubel hits, finally the stand has been broken
and gets a wicket off a high full toss outside off, Elton cannot get under it as he swings hard, and for once a catch is taken, at long off

headshotImage.caption: Forster Mutizwa player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Forster Mutizwa player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Shakib, darted in on a length with the angle from wide of the crease, straightening around off stump, and hitting him in front of off as he missed the sweep, given right away

dismissalText.long: c Junaid Siddique b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Junaid Siddique b Shafiul Islam 4 (20b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Taylor has thrown it away, shortish and wide outside off stump, he could have easily left it alone, went hard at it without much foot movement from the crease, and the edge flew straight to slip

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain 27 (36b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: they have got the big one, they haven't given anything away today, Sibanda goes for the pull, is in no position as the short ball gets big on him outside off, and the edge comes down on the off side, Kayes reaches to it and finds Shakib settling under the ball, but manages to hold on and then stares at Shakib

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 18 (13b 1x4 1x6 11m) SR: 138.46

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, Ervine abandons the crease again, but Mahmudullah drags it a touch short and angles it across slowly, he tries to drive through extra cover but is beaten by the turn, and Rahim has an easy stumping

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Shakib, darted in on a length with the angle from wide of the crease, straightening around off stump, and hitting him in front of off as he missed the sweep, given right away

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sibanda b Mpofu 101 (100b 8x4 1x6 148m) SR: 101

dismissalComment.html: Rahim cannot do it for Bangladesh, what a tragic end, one scoring shot away from glory, it was pitched up and he went for it, for the big one down the ground, but did not get enough on it, it swirled towards long on who grasped it in near-darkness, the crowd erupts, Zimbabwe have won the series, Mpofu has uprooted a stump and taken off

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Mpofu/†Taibu) 44 (62b 2x4 0x6 100m) SR: 70.96

dismissalComment.html: Mpofu does it for Zimbabwe, rips in the throw from deep square leg, they took on the fast bowler's throwing arm, and came second, the ball came in a nice height on the bounce to Taibu, who whipped off the bails before Tamim's gloves could find the crease with a despairing dive, he had dropped his bat midway intentionally, probably to pick up some pace, as he turned around for the second run after whipping one through square leg, what a waste of a wicket!

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: doesn't matter, he gets him this time, umpire Dharmasena has no doubts now, flighted delivery, straightening, again he pushes outside the line for the turn, there isn't much, struck on the pad in front of leg, and Zimbabwe celebrate

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Utseya is celebrating, he has taken off for a run, he has got another one, tossed up delivery dipping full around leg stump, he goes for a push down the ground and hits it straight back to Utseya
Utseya gets the big wicket

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he has found Taylor this time, it is rest of Bangladesh against Rahim, and the former is hanging in there, Nasir tries to smoke another short ball over midwicket, top edge swirls in the air and finds Taylor as it comes down

headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shuvagata Hom run out (†Taibu/Vitori) 32 (36b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: needless run out, absolutely needless, another waste of a wicket, running in to trouble is Hom, he has batted brilliantly on debut, but has given it away, punched off the back foot towards extra cover who gets to the ball quickly, Hom carries on running furiously towards Rahim who hasn't moved much apart from taking a couple of steps out, and Taibu has one of the easiest run-outs of his career

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Masakadza b Vitori 14 (11b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 127.27

dismissalComment.html: Vitori gets a wicket, bangs it in short with the angle, he goes for the pull from outside off, and finds long on, still Bangladesh's game, but they keep shooting themselves in the foot

headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he has found Taylor this time, it is rest of Bangladesh against Rahim, and the former is hanging in there, Nasir tries to smoke another short ball over midwicket, top edge swirls in the air and finds Taylor as it comes down

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiul Islam b Jarvis 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Jarvis has gone through Shafiul in fading light, Shafiul going for another heave, this time Jarvis was on target, Shafiul missed again, Jarvis found leg stump with a full length and roared, Rahim stood helpless

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Jarvis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Jarvis roars again, this game has turned again, pinpoint yorker on the middle stump, too good delivery to get at any time, much too good in fading light, perfect against No 10, wood is uprooted and the crowd gets behind Jarvis

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sibanda b Mpofu 101 (100b 8x4 1x6 148m) SR: 101

dismissalComment.html: Rahim cannot do it for Bangladesh, what a tragic end, one scoring shot away from glory, it was pitched up and he went for it, for the big one down the ground, but did not get enough on it, it swirled towards long on who grasped it in near-darkness, the crowd erupts, Zimbabwe have won the series, Mpofu has uprooted a stump and taken off

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sibanda b Mpofu 101 (100b 8x4 1x6 148m) SR: 101

commentTextItems.html: Rahim cannot do it for Bangladesh, what a tragic end, one scoring shot away from glory, it was pitched up and he went for it, for the big one down the ground, but did not get enough on it, it swirled towards long on who grasped it in near-darkness, the crowd erupts, Zimbabwe have won the series, Mpofu has uprooted a stump and taken off

commentPostTextItems.html: A game that burst into a frenetic flurry of wickets and boundaries in the end. Zimbabwe have their first series win over Test-level opposition in five years. That is all from us, join us for the fourth game from Bulawayo on Friday at 9.30 am local time (1.30 pm Bangladesh time). This is Abhishek Purohit signing off, with a final mention of the spunky Mushfiqur Rahim's valiant effort. Cheers.

Taylor: "I am over the moon, Credit to the work we have put in over the months, to the support staff as well. I thought we had done about enough, the ball doesn't do much in the afternoon, but we had the bowlers, the guys kept their heads together and pulled it off. I just thought I would keep changing my bowlers around. With no Price to contain the bowlers, Jarvis showed a mature head. [We will have] a bit of celebration tonight."
Mushfiqur Rahim is the Man of the Match. He has done some damage to his hamstring apparently and Shakib accepts the award on his behalf.

Shakib: "Not close enough, We bowled well, I think fielding cost us the game, with such fielding it is very hard to win a game, but nothing to take away from Zimbabwe. We knew the wicket would be better in the afternoon, and if we batted well we should win. We knew Rahim had the ability to score big runs, the way he played we can take lots of positives. The young legs are doing well at the moment, the experienced ones are starting to chip in, we are getting it together, but it is too late."
Zimbabwe are doing a lap of the Harare Sports Club, in scenes reminiscent of the win in their comeback Test some days ago

Mushfiqur Rahim battled Zimbabwe and Bangladesh for 100 deliveries, but it was too much for him in the end. Zimbabwe kept coming back with wickets at the other end, Bangladesh kept making it tougher for him with mindless running. He kept finding the boundaries with nerveless regularity, but the final one proved elusive and led to his downfall.

Hugh: "Absolutely devastated for Mushfiqur - that has to go down as one of the finest innings in ODI history - perfectly paced. But for shambolic batting from his partners (although well done to debutant Hom) he would have led them to a famous victory."
Elphas: "The chess game ends,with the closest of margins.Well done Zimbabwe."
Bilal: "Cricket at its finest.It proves whether the giants or minnows of the game play ,it is always great fun to watch a nail bitter."
bandish: "watching a desolate mushfiqur walk past the rejoicing zimbabweans, in heart of my heart, i was expecting a lee-flintoff moment! alas, it never came!"
Harsha: "Self destruction at its worst!! This game could have lifted Bangladesh's spirit to keep fighting...But thoughtlessness prevailed..."

commentPreTextItems.html: Hunbbel: "This game is just ain't finishing!!! Amazing stuff. Cricket at its best!"

commentTextItems.html: it is too dark at the ground, Rahim somehow slaps this fullish one past extra cover, and gets back for the second, maiden ODI hundred, he aint celebrating yet

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Jarvis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

commentTextItems.html: Jarvis roars again, this game has turned again, pinpoint yorker on the middle stump, too good delivery to get at any time, much too good in fading light, perfect against No 10, wood is uprooted and the crowd gets behind Jarvis

headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: he moves to 99 with a slap towards extra cover, one ball left in the over

commentPreTextItems.html: Kamal: "This is ridiculous. I coudn't see the ball even in replays. Reminds me 2007 WC final."

commentTextItems.html: Rahim refuses to let it go away, his will is immense, his sight is working well in the dying light, and he whacks Jarvis' length ball way over the deep midwicket buundary
that is a classy looking cover drive off a full and widish one, there is a man there, but Rahim will get on strike

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiul Islam b Jarvis 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Jarvis has gone through Shafiul in fading light, Shafiul going for another heave, this time Jarvis was on target, Shafiul missed again, Jarvis found leg stump with a full length and roared, Rahim stood helpless

commentPreTextItems.html: Robert: "never over until the Fat Lady sings, and she sure is not singing yet."

commentTextItems.html: Rahim is at the non-striker's end, he can only watch as Shafiul has a go at a widish length ball and misses
Mpofu hurls in another yorker, bat cannot get down in time, he finds the pad, looked to be going down leg, not given

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: the yorker, he digs it out on the leg side and they scamper through without any issues
Rahim decides to do it alone, and that seems to be the right way, gets the pull wide enough of deep midwicket, immense composure under pressure
Mpofu bowls the slower one in to the batsman, he cannot get it past midwicket, non-striker has to get back in time

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Taylor b Mpofu 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: he has found Taylor this time, it is rest of Bangladesh against Rahim, and the former is hanging in there, Nasir tries to smoke another short ball over midwicket, top edge swirls in the air and finds Taylor as it comes down

commentPreTextItems.html: Karn: "Hitherto, Mushy has played wonderfully. What impresses the most about this innings is how he rotated the strike; and now he's pulling out the boundaries at just the perfect time. Wonderful!"
Qavi: "if this would have been test match then umpires would have called light, its very dark there."

commentTextItems.html: falls short of short midwicket, he looked to pull a rising shortish ball, it came slowly and he almost hit it straight to Taylor

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Masakadza b Vitori 14 (11b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 127.27

commentTextItems.html: Vitori gets a wicket, bangs it in short with the angle, he goes for the pull from outside off, and finds long on, still Bangladesh's game, but they keep shooting themselves in the foot

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: there was width this time from a length, but Mahmudullah could not bat on to it as he reached out
low full toss fired in around off, he eases it past the bowler down the ground
he betters himself, makes room as Vitori gets it very full for once, but Rahim manages to squeeze it in the air between short third man and backward point
Rahim gets another one off the middle of the bat, Zimbabwe keep bowling it around a length, and RAhim keeps tonking them, over midwicket with the angle, just bounces inside the boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: Tim: "This is almost Bevanlike from Mushy."

commentTextItems.html: bowls it in from wide of the crease, Rahim backs away for the cut, but is beaten by the angle and the pace

dismissalText.commentary: Forster Mutizwa lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Shakib, darted in on a length with the angle from wide of the crease, straightening around off stump, and hitting him in front of off as he missed the sweep, given right away

dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya not out 4 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: Taylor has thrown it away, shortish and wide outside off stump, he could have easily left it alone, went hard at it without much foot movement from the crease, and the edge flew straight to slip

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: and out of nowhere, they pull off a stunner, Taibu is gone, big wicket, it was a high full toss whipped away wide of long leg where Rubel made good ground, dived forward to take it low, and then went scrambling along the ground

they have got the big one, they haven't given anything away today, Sibanda goes for the pull, is in no position as the short ball gets big on him outside off, and the edge comes down on the off side, Kayes reaches to it and finds Shakib settling under the ball, but manages to hold on and then stares at Shakib
got 'em, Rubel uproots the leg stump, full delivery slanted in, Masakadza makes room to go over the off side, misses the swing, and the Rubel hits, finally the stand has been broken

gone this time, Ervine abandons the crease again, but Mahmudullah drags it a touch short and angles it across slowly, he tries to drive through extra cover but is beaten by the turn, and Rahim has an easy stumping
and gets a wicket off a high full toss outside off, Elton cannot get under it as he swings hard, and for once a catch is taken, at long off

dismissalText.long: c Junaid Siddique b Shafiul Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Junaid Siddique b Shafiul Islam 4 (20b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Taylor has thrown it away, shortish and wide outside off stump, he could have easily left it alone, went hard at it without much foot movement from the crease, and the edge flew straight to slip

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Imrul Kayes b Rubel Hossain 27 (36b 5x4 0x6 57m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: they have got the big one, they haven't given anything away today, Sibanda goes for the pull, is in no position as the short ball gets big on him outside off, and the edge comes down on the off side, Kayes reaches to it and finds Shakib settling under the ball, but manages to hold on and then stares at Shakib

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Rubel Hossain 74 (100b 4x4 2x6 145m) SR: 74

dismissalComment.html: got 'em, Rubel uproots the leg stump, full delivery slanted in, Masakadza makes room to go over the off side, misses the swing, and the Rubel hits, finally the stand has been broken

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mahmudullah 18 (13b 1x4 1x6 11m) SR: 138.46

dismissalComment.html: gone this time, Ervine abandons the crease again, but Mahmudullah drags it a touch short and angles it across slowly, he tries to drive through extra cover but is beaten by the turn, and Rahim has an easy stumping

dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu c Rubel Hossain b Nazmul Hossain 83 (103b 8x4 0x6 136m) SR: 80.58

dismissalComment.html: and out of nowhere, they pull off a stunner, Taibu is gone, big wicket, it was a high full toss whipped away wide of long leg where Rubel made good ground, dived forward to take it low, and then went scrambling along the ground

dismissalText.long: c Rubel Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Rubel Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 31 (21b 1x4 2x6 21m) SR: 147.61

dismissalComment.html: and gets a wicket off a high full toss outside off, Elton cannot get under it as he swings hard, and for once a catch is taken, at long off

headshotImage.longCaption: Forster Mutizwa player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Forster Mutizwa player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Forster Mutizwa lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Shakib, darted in on a length with the angle from wide of the crease, straightening around off stump, and hitting him in front of off as he missed the sweep, given right away

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Mpofu/†Taibu) 44 (62b 2x4 0x6 100m) SR: 70.96

dismissalComment.html: Mpofu does it for Zimbabwe, rips in the throw from deep square leg, they took on the fast bowler's throwing arm, and came second, the ball came in a nice height on the bounce to Taibu, who whipped off the bails before Tamim's gloves could find the crease with a despairing dive, he had dropped his bat midway intentionally, probably to pick up some pace, as he turned around for the second run after whipping one through square leg, what a waste of a wicket!

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes lbw b Utseya 16 (39b 2x4 0x6 48m) SR: 41.02

dismissalComment.html: doesn't matter, he gets him this time, umpire Dharmasena has no doubts now, flighted delivery, straightening, again he pushes outside the line for the turn, there isn't much, struck on the pad in front of leg, and Zimbabwe celebrate

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Siddique player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Zunaed Siddique c & b Utseya 12 (19b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 63.15

dismissalComment.html: Utseya is celebrating, he has taken off for a run, he has got another one, tossed up delivery dipping full around leg stump, he goes for a push down the ground and hits it straight back to Utseya

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Sibanda b Mpofu 101 (100b 8x4 1x6 148m) SR: 101

dismissalComment.html: Rahim cannot do it for Bangladesh, what a tragic end, one scoring shot away from glory, it was pitched up and he went for it, for the big one down the ground, but did not get enough on it, it swirled towards long on who grasped it in near-darkness, the crowd erupts, Zimbabwe have won the series, Mpofu has uprooted a stump and taken off

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c & b Utseya 19 (22b 1x4 1x6 29m) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: Utseya gets the big wicket

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shuvagata Hom run out (†Taibu/Vitori) 32 (36b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: needless run out, absolutely needless, another waste of a wicket, running in to trouble is Hom, he has batted brilliantly on debut, but has given it away, punched off the back foot towards extra cover who gets to the ball quickly, Hom carries on running furiously towards Rahim who hasn't moved much apart from taking a couple of steps out, and Taibu has one of the easiest run-outs of his career

headshotImage.caption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Brian Vitori player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Masakadza b Vitori 14 (11b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 127.27

dismissalComment.html: Vitori gets a wicket, bangs it in short with the angle, he goes for the pull from outside off, and finds long on, still Bangladesh's game, but they keep shooting themselves in the foot

headshotImage.caption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Mpofu player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Taylor b Mpofu 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he has found Taylor this time, it is rest of Bangladesh against Rahim, and the former is hanging in there, Nasir tries to smoke another short ball over midwicket, top edge swirls in the air and finds Taylor as it comes down

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiul Islam b Jarvis 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Jarvis has gone through Shafiul in fading light, Shafiul going for another heave, this time Jarvis was on target, Shafiul missed again, Jarvis found leg stump with a full length and roared, Rahim stood helpless

headshotImage.caption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kyle Jarvis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain b Jarvis 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Jarvis roars again, this game has turned again, pinpoint yorker on the middle stump, too good delivery to get at any time, much too good in fading light, perfect against No 10, wood is uprooted and the crowd gets behind Jarvis

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Zimbabwe innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 22 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 18 runs, 1 wicket)
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 41/2 in 16.0 overs (H Masakadza 7, T Taibu 1)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 18.4 overs (112 balls), Extras 2
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 66 balls (H Masakadza 21, T Taibu 30, Ex 0)
Zimbabwe: 100 runs in 26.5 overs (161 balls), Extras 2
Drinks: Zimbabwe - 128/2 in 34.0 overs (H Masakadza 46, T Taibu 49)
T Taibu: 50 off 73 balls, 82 mins (6 x 4)
H Masakadza: 50 off 80 balls, 117 mins (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 133 balls (H Masakadza 44, T Taibu 56, Ex 0)
Zimbabwe: 150 runs in 36.6 overs (222 balls), Extras 2
Powerplay 3: Overs 37.1 - 42.0 (Batting side - 32 runs, 1 wicket)
Zimbabwe: 200 runs in 44.1 overs (265 balls), Extras 4
Zimbabwe: 250 runs in 49.6 overs (300 balls), Extras 6
Innings Break: Zimbabwe - 250/7 in 50.0 overs (P Utseya 4, KM Jarvis 1)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 38 runs, 0 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0 (Bowling side - 21 runs, 1 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 10.6 overs (66 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 66 balls (Tamim Iqbal 31, Imrul Kayes 16, Ex 3)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 66/2 in 17.1 overs (Tamim Iqbal 35)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 25.3 overs (153 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: Bangladesh - 133/4 in 34.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 36, Shuvagoto Hom 3)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 35.6 overs (216 balls), Extras 4
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 70 balls, 98 mins (3 x 4)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 54 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 22, Shuvagata Hom 26, Ex 2)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 43.6 overs (264 balls), Extras 5
Powerplay 3: Overs 44.1 - 49.0 (Batting side - 43 runs, 4 wickets)
Mushfiqur Rahim: 100 off 99 balls (8 x 4, 1 x 6)

stories.title: Mushfiqur Rahim looks back at seven of his most important innings for Bangladesh
stories.seoTitle: Mushfiqur Rahim looks back at seven of his most important innings for Bangladesh
stories.summary: From his debut at Lord's to the double-hundred in Galle, and other match-winning knocks in between

stories.title: Poor catching, 'silly' mistakes cost us - Law
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Harare
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI: Poor catching, 'silly' mistakes cost us, says Stuart Law
stories.summary: Stuart Law, the Bangladesh coach, has put his team's five-run defeat down to poor catching and some "silly mistakes" at the wrong time

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives down the ground
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim drives down the ground, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Harare,

stories.title: Alan Butcher hails 'significant' win
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Harare
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh: Alan Butcher hails 'significant' win
stories.summary: Alan Butcher, the Zimbabwe coach, has said the ODI series triumph over Bangladesh is a major boost to the confidence of a team that experienced tough times in the past

image.caption: Zimbabwe on a lap of honour after securing the ODI series against Bangladesh
image.longCaption: Zimbabwe on a lap of honour after securing the ODI series against Bangladesh with two matches left to play, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Harare, August 16, 2011

stories.title: Zimbabwe overcome Mushfiqur to take series
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 3rd ODI, Harare
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh: Zimbabwe overcome Mushfiqur to take series
stories.summary: Mushfiqur Rahim's century was in vain as Bangladesh lost a thrilling match in Harare to hand Zimbabwe the series, with two games left to play
